As we dove into development, one major challenge emerged: two teammates had conflicting schedules, which made collaboration and consistent progress difficult. Additionally, midway through the sprint, we discovered that the API we planned to use for personalized productivity tips had recently deprecated a key feature we were relying on.

Task:
As the acting team lead, I had to find a way to keep everyone aligned despite time constraints, and quickly pivot our tech stack to find a new solution — all while keeping the team motivated and confident that we could still succeed.

Action:
To address the scheduling issue, I created an asynchronous workflow using a shared Notion board and a Slack channel with daily updates, so even if someone missed a meeting, they could catch up quickly and still contribute.

Regarding the deprecated API, I led a mini spike session to explore alternatives. We ended up switching to an open-source solution and modified our code to adapt to the new format. I assigned one developer to focus solely on the integration, and I worked alongside them to make up for lost time.

I also maintained open communication, being transparent about the challenges and using humor and encouragement to keep morale high.

Result:
Despite these hurdles, we delivered a complete, functioning prototype on time. Our ability to adapt and remain cohesive under pressure impressed the judges and helped secure our top-5 finish. The experience also taught our team how to work effectively in a fast-paced, unpredictable environment — and taught me the value of proactive problem-solving and empathetic leadership.
